ActivityTitle: Major Areas of the Human Cerebral Cortex
QuestionStem: The cerebral cortex is an important part of the human brain. The magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) shows the brain structures inside this human head. Explore the illustration to find out how information is processed in the major areas of the cerebral cortex.

content.imageAlt: In this activity, there is a diagram of the human brain. You can click on the hotspots for more information about the functions of the frontal lobe, the parietal lobe, the occipital lobe, and the temporal lobe.

panels.title: Frontal lobe
panels.description: The frontal lobe is the “boss.” It coordinates planning, organization, behaviors, and emotions.

panels.title: Parietal lobe
panels.description: The parietal lobe processes sensory information related to taste, temperature, and touch.

panels.title: Temporal lobe
panels.description: The temporal lobe is associated with hearing, language, and olfactory senses.

panels.title: Occipital lobe
panels.description: The occipital lobes are involved in the reception of visual stimuli.
